fields.description:
(We recently upgraded to 2.1.4 and I could have sworn Confluence didn't work like this before, but maybe I'm wrong.)

When I change the parent page of an existing page that has children, all the children are orphaned and I must re-parent them. This can be very timeconsuming. Am I doing something wrong??
fields.summary: Changing a parent's page orphans its children

fields.description:
One of our users tried to change the space logo and uploaded a large picture (pic A). Confluence was able to upload this and changed the logo to it. He then tried to change the logo to another picture (pic B) after seeing the size, he was able to browse to pic B to upload it, click on upload and Confluence reported everything being ok, however it hadn't actually uploaded the new picture, just changed the logo back to pic A.

We changed the space logo back to the default (clicking on 'Reset Logo to Default') and uploaded pic B again, Confluence reported everything as being ok but had again changed the logo to pic A.

We double checked that the new picture we were trying to load was definitely different (it was), basically whatever picture we tried to upload Confluence would just revert to the original picture uploaded.

We were able to change the logo by logging on to Confluence from another machine. 

Have you seen this before?
fields.summary: Unable to change space logo
confluenceSoapService.getPage() crashes with confluence-soap-0.1 and Confluence 3.5.3-#135

fields.description:
For any label I call it, it returns NULL.
I'm using the confluence-soap-0.1 "prepackaged" client.
fields.summary: remoteLabel.getOwner() returns NULL

fields.description:
I attempting to type 1ntern@t10n@l in wiki page.
When I type this i get displayed with a text box where the first @ sign is and a space for the second.

To resolve this issue you can display it in a panel: 
{code} 1ntern@t10@nl {code}
fields.summary: Typing the @ Symbol with characters before and after it creates a text box and space

fields.description:
This is currently by design, as it allows confluence-administrators special access to "save" a space when the permissions are set to lock everyone else out.

It will be resolved once we replace this "superuser" access with admin functionality for fixing broken space permissions (CONF-4616).
fields.summary: Dashboard shows all spaces for confluence-administrators group but not for users with 'Administrate' permission

fields.description: Confluence currently produces Atom 0.3 feeds. With the release of Rome 0.8, we can now safely move to Atom 1.0 and deprecate 0.3 as recommended by the IETF.
fields.summary: Move Atom feeds to Atom 1.0

fields.description:
When creating a table, it shows up with dynamic width columns on the HTML page, but when you export the page to PDF, the columns end up all the same width. This looks horrible when one column is "project number" and has 4 characters in it and the next column is "description" and has 7 lines of wrapped text because both columns are the same width in the PDF.


To reproduce, create a table like this on a page and export to PDF:

||Project||Date||Description||
|1234|4-Apr-06|This is a very long description that I am typing in this column as an example of the ugly formatting when you export a table to PDF. Is there any way to format the PDF so the first two columns are skinny and the last one is wide (the way it appears in a browser). Thanks.|
fields.summary: Tables in PDF Exports have the same width for every column. Width should be appropriate to the column content.

fields.description: In confluence, edit a page, select text and add a link.  Click the search and get search results more than one page.  If you select a result from the first page and double click -- it appear at the top as the link but you can't get out the the screen to get back to the page.  If the search resutls in one  page, then the screen has an OK or Cancel button.
fields.summary: Can't select a page as a link via the search

fields.description: when some users login to confluence the recently updated items pane is replaced by the error "Error rendering macro: java.lang.NullPointerException". the exception from catalina.out is attached. not all users have this behavior.
fields.summary: recently updated items NullPointerException for some users
Support multiple LDAP security providers

fields.description:
To reproduce include an image in a page and display it twice using the following markup:

!backus-debug.png!
!backus-debug.png|width=500! 

When exporting to PDF, both images will have the same size. The export should honor the width property of the image and re-size it appropriately.
fields.summary: PDF export does not honor image width property

fields.description: {blog-posts:labels=foo} results in all news being shown if the label foo is not attached to any news items.
fields.summary: blog-posts + label that doesn't exist results in all news shown

fields.description:
Because the autodiscoverable RSS feeds are by default unauthenticated, this means you can click on the RSS feed and see nothing, when you see lots of stuff on the page.

Add a check so that if the user is logged in, their discoverable RSS feeds are all authenticated/private.
fields.summary: Add authentication to discoverable RSS feeds when user is logged in

fields.description: RSS autodiscovery isn't obvious enough. Add a feed icon to the icon-list (beside printable/pdf/etc)
fields.summary: Add feed icon to pages with discoverable RSS
Mail: support decoding of non-ASCII headers

fields.description:
The servlet that starts up Glue should detect if Confluence is running under JRockit, and if so log a FATAL message, and not start. The message should be:

"The Glue SOAP library is not compatible with JRockit.  /rpc/soap and /rpc/soap-glue will not be available. Please use /rpc/soap-axis instead."
fields.summary: Disable Glue servlet on JRockit

fields.description: Can not create subpages of page which has internationalized name (I've tried cyrilic only, however, think it does not work if page names are in other languages/encodings). When I'm trying to submit newly created page error says "Page ${PARENT PAGE} does not exists " is raised.
fields.summary: International page names

fields.description: see attached
fields.summary: System Error when attempting to view/edit draft

fields.description:
Currently we have two issues with confluence wiki

1. we deployed confluence in websphere cluster environment.  we accessed the application from one instance and configured all db connection, license, etc and got everything working.  However, when we accessed from another cluster instance, the application was asking configuration setup again instead of reading the data from setup we have done from instance 1.

2. We like to configure confluence home to be on a external file server instead on websphere application server.  We have tried several time without success.  By the way, the websphere is running on an account which has read/write permission on remote external file server.
fields.summary: confluence in cluster and external file server

fields.description:
The {tasklist} macro does not obey the edit rights associated with the hosting page.  For example, I have a page which can only be edited by myself.  My expectation is that the task list may only be edited by myself but it appears that tasks can be checked/unchecked by anybody.

Many thanks,
Michael Marconi
fields.summary: {tasklist} Macro does not obey edit rights

fields.description:
I delete group - confluence-users (name convence).

If I create new user, confluence-users is automatic create and user is join to confluence-users group.

confluence-users is not default group form my Confluence instance.
Secure is create usere without assign to group.
fields.summary: Group confluence-users - create for each new user

fields.description: It seems that when the external referrer settings were moved to their own configuration page (in 1.3), the help settings weren't moved either. They need to be moved to the correct help file.
fields.summary: External referrer settings in the general config help file need to be moved to the correct place
Allow editing of content-type of attachments

fields.description: The General Configuration interface is confusing - all the options are rammed together in a semi-random order. Could do with (at the very least) some coherent grouping.
fields.summary: Clean up General Configuration
Use shorter anchor names in HTML rendering mode
History of recent Feed Builder feeds

fields.description:
For some users, even though we added all space permissions to them, they still only see "edit" link besides the attachments in the space.  The "remove" link is not there.

We tried adding them to groups allowed to remove attachments in the space, adding them to the space with all permissions, and even adding them as administrators, but they don't see that "remove" link.  Only happens to some users (2 users so far).
fields.summary: No "remove" link displayed for some users who are authorized to remove those attachments
Improve Index macro to index by page(s), blogs, news, space, etc.

fields.description: Load the Word document in the attachment, it's a simple table with multipline lines and some text effects. In Word select the table and copy it into the rich text editor in confluence. Click on preview and you will see the ugly result in the attached screenshot. Checking the wiki markup shows an additional blank inside the table.
fields.summary: Copy/Paste of a word table to the rich text editor gives ugly results

fields.description: The package name in confluence-soap-0.1.jar looks ugly and Eclipse couldn't auto-import it.
fields.summary: Package name "com.atlassian.www.software.confluence.$Proxy42.ConfluenceServiceLocator " causes problems with Eclipse
Casing inconsistency in API domain objects: "Space.homepage" VS "Page.homePage"

fields.description:
The attached PDF file does have some password properties and encryption, however it can opened and read without any need for a password.
However Confluence indexing indexes the pdf in encrypted form....
fields.summary: Confluence can't index certain types of PDF files

fields.description: The insert link popup would be a lot more useful if the space name was displayed next to each of the items.
fields.summary: Insert link popup should show the space each page belongs to

fields.description: The history popup would be a lot more useful if the space name was displayed next to each of the items.
fields.summary: User History popup should show the space each page belongs to
tracking confluence statistics inquiry

fields.description:
See the following:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Wildfire+Presence+Macrosgd

This should return a status code of 404.
fields.summary: Page Not Found should return a HTTP Status of 404 not 200

fields.description:
If a file with a "ä", "ö", "ü", ... in its name is attached to a Confluence page the following problems occur:
- file can't be removed, nor edited (error-message:The page you were trying to reach does not exist. You may want to try a search, or browse the site to find the page you were looking for)
- file can't be linked from the confluence page (error-message:The page you were trying to reach does not exist. You may want to try a search, or browse the site to find the page you were looking for)
fields.summary: attachements with name containing "ä", "ö", "ü", ....
Create an icon glossary within Confluence

fields.description: Ben has seen a problem where he saves a page, then goes to edit the page and is toold that there is a saved dcraft. Perhaps a race condition while saving?
fields.summary: Previous version exists after saving

fields.description:
In German Jira, the reopened status has an umlaute ('Wieder geöffnet'). Setting up an icon mapping works, but this isn't picked up by the jiraissues macro.

See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Jiraissues mappings don't support status with umlaut (internationalised text)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5813].
  {panel}

I would like to create an easy link to a label within a space or within a site.

For example to list all pages with a particular label, I would like to write something akin to the [^attatchment.txt] or [#anchor] or [term@shortcut] or [$idref] notation.

Perhaps [SpaceKey:pagetitle!mylabel] (where SpaceKet is the space key, pagetitle is the page title and mylabel is the label I want to link to within the space/page)

Currently I can hard-code the URL as such: [mylabel|http://confluenceserver.com/label/spacekey/mylabel]

Thanks!
fields.summary: Create a link to a label

fields.description:
v215 build 411

1. With NavMap macro, if you specify a label which is also a label of the space, the nav map fails to appear and fails to give a warning message.  Once I removed the label from the space level, the navmap reappears as expected.

Change request 1: if the label is a space label, please display the navmap the same as if the space-level label did not exist.

2.If you specify a label which does not exist at all in the space, there is a NULL exception thrown. (despite previous posts which claim this should be fixed in 2.1.5)

Change request 2: if the label does not exist, display a more friendly message, OR just display a navmap with the title, but no links, rather than an unfriendly error message.

Thank you.
fields.summary: NAVMAP macro displays nothing if given a space-level label

fields.description:
Entered "one&two" value in the Add Task and result appeared cut, only "one".
After short look into tasklist.js in the dynamictasklist plugin, it looks like the problem is caused by passing un URI encoded value of the value in the URL. See inside of addTask function:
    ...
    uri = uri + "?task=" + formElem.task.value;

That most probably what causes it. Use of escape(...) will probably fix the issue.
fields.summary: dynamictasklist macro: doesn't support XML escapes
Tasks with same name in different lists aren't distinguished

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5808].
  {panel}

In previous versions of Confluence, Space Administrators could access the "Layout" page in "Space Administration" to edit the Space Theme manually (the Velocity files specifically). It appears that at some point after Confluence 2.0 this ability was removed due to security concerns but the documentation was not updated at the time. I ran into this and filed the following bug at http://support.atlassian.com -- CSP-3044.

~~~~~~~~~~~

I had a call from a Space Administrator today who was trying to modify the custom decorators for a space per these instructions.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF20/Working+with+Custom+Decorators

However, he couldn't view the "Layout" link in the "Look and Feel" section of the "Space Administration" page (he only had 3 items there rather than 4). To test, I created a user, gave it space administration privileges and verified I couldn't see the "Layout" link. Interestingly enough, my regular user which has full Confluence Administration privileges ("Administrate Confluence" in "Global Permissions") could see the "Layout" link in "Space Administration".

Some further testing showed that the only users who can see the "Layout" button in the "Space Administration" page are those with full "Administrate Confluence" privileges.

Since the documentation above says "You need to be a space administrator to edit decorator files." I'm presuming this is a bug and hope it can be easily/quickly fixed.

I also tried to manually go to the layout link as a space administrator user and was denied with a "You are not permitted to perform this operation." message.

Thanks for your help. 

~~~~~~~~~

The response was that "Unfortunately it is a security risk to allow space administrators to put arbitrary velocity markup in layouts -- they could escalate their priviledges to those of the global administrator."

I then noted that the docs were incorrect and asked if this had changed recently....the answer was "At one time they could. The ideal solution would be to make sure that a 'bad' layout can't produce a security problem, but that's hard. You can raise a feature request for more granular permissions at http://jira.atlassian.com and we will consider it. ".

So....I'm making a feature request here that Space Administrators could selectively be allowed to edit the Layout files (Velocity files). I'm not very picky as to whether it's a global Confluence preference (i.e. all Space Administrators can edit Layout files) or an extra Space permissions.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Allow Space Administrators Access to the Space Layout

fields.description: {foo:bar|baz} becomes {foo:bar\|baz} after round-trip
fields.summary: Pipes in user macros get escaped

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5806].
  {panel}

The addition of adding change comments and indication of minor updates was a good idea but it is not used very effectively.  One reason is that this information isn't readily visible and used regularly.  The suggestion would be to include mouse over text on each place that has a "view changes" link that would indicate:
1) Minor update or note
2) Change comment
Once this information becomes more visible to users, its more likely people will start putting in useful information.
fields.summary: View change mouse over could show change comment

fields.description:
I have installed the standalone version on a Solaris box, using the demo data and the embedded database.

When trying to export the "Demo space" in HTML format, it takes many minutes until it is completed. I noticed that the confluence_home/temp/export_xxxx/ds/ directory contains an incomplete html file (0 bytes length) for a few minutes, then that file is finished, but now there is another file with 0 bytes length. It looks as if Confluence just sits there waiting for something. Finally, there will be a completed zip file having all selected contents though.

The box is behind a firewall and has no connection to the world. Maybe it is (errorneously) attempting to access something and hangs until it times out?
fields.summary: HTML Space export is very slow

fields.description: Links like [http://192.168.200.102:8088/cpu.html|!http://192.168.200.102:8088/cpu-day.png!] are not possible

The end-of-head and end of body do not appear to share the same problem.

fields.description:
When users not in the confluence-admin LDAP group (or a group that has admin privilages) they get the following error on login.

CONFLUENCE 
System Error 
A system error has occurred - our apologies! 
Please create a support issue on our support system at http://support.atlassian.com with the following information: 

a description of your problem and what you were doing at the time it occurred 
cut & paste the error and system information found below 
attach the application server log file (if possible). 

We will respond as promptly as possible.
Thank you!

fields.summary: NullPointerException for non-admin users when logging in

fields.description:
The progress window of the mail import does not refresh; the progress bar remains completely red. I get the following Javascript error:

Error: uncaught exception: Permission denied to call method XMLHttpRequest.open

I'm using the lastest version of Firefox and I have Javascript turned on.
fields.summary: Mail import progress screen does not refresh

fields.description:
Administrator now cannot chagen data in personal page (admin/users/viewuser.action). Why?

My problem no. 1: I must change internal phone number.
My problem no. 2: I must change welcom page for new users (with describe Confluence).
Virtual problem: User have vulgar words or picture in profile page.

Action now: I must change password, login as one user, change data and logout. User must activate Forgot password, view mail, login and change password.
It's not easy for global change.
fields.summary: Administrators cannot modify a user's profile information
Ability to sort search results
Ability to specify the the maximum results per page for search results

fields.description: A smiley inserted in the wysiwyg editor may end up producing markup with no surrounding whitespace, which breaks the emoticon

Selecting several lines and applying the heading style produces incorrect markup

fields.description:
When using standalone with Java 1.4.2, exporting a page using some types of PNG's result in a PDF which throws the Error "109" when trying to view in Adobe PDF Viewer.

Java 1.5 however doesn't seem to produce the same problem - see the files attached, The image file being used has been taken from previous issue CONF-3609.
fields.summary: Certain PNG images in pages cause corrupt PDF exports for pre Java 1.5

We need to convert this form into a POST, maybe with a checkbox for each icon.

Changing passwords stores clear text passwords for local users when LDAP is enabled

fields.description:
Upon installing a clean Confluence instance, the new admin user receives the following message when attempting to view his *own* profile:

"You do not have permission to access /display/~admin. To access this page, please log in as a user with sufficient permissions."

The login screen is then presented.

Admin user is unable to view any profile (not sure about regular users viewing others or their own).
fields.summary: Profile Permission Problem - Clean Install

fields.description:
Wiki source editing was very nice until the WYSIWYG-Editor was introduced.

You could add extra spaces to format tables and keep them maintainable. These spaces are eaten up now.
fields.summary: Confluence loses wiki source formatting since the WYSIWYG-Editor was introduced.

fields.description:
The WYSIWYG-Editor may be nice for some people, but it sucks when you are used to the Wiki syntax.

Every user should be able to decide on his own if we wants to have it as default or not.
fields.summary: Allow enabling/disabling the WYSIWYG-Editor per User
Thumbnails: determine size of new window
Syntax Highlighting Wiki Markup
Add promptOnDelete parameter to dynamic tasklist macro (default: true)
Improve performance of XML backup and restore

fields.description: Because the 'editLabelsLink' item doesn't exist for users who can't edit labels, the javascript which changes the visibility of the link throws an error
fields.summary: Javascript error for anonymous users

fields.description:
if you not login , view any page of confluence

will got a javascript error. 

because :

#if ($action.isPrintableVersion() == false)
    <script type="text/javascript">
        // if there is javascript support, enable the [Edit] link that enables AJAX label adding/removing functionality
        document.getElementById('editLabelsLink').style.display = 'inline';
    </script>
#end


if not login,then no the link,so error occur
fields.summary: when view a page,Javascript error, user not login

fields.description: Anchor links insist that the page they are on exists, so links in preview/wysiwyg while creating a page, and on templates are shown in pink. This is confusing, as there is nothing actually wrong.
fields.summary: Links to anchors are displayed as bad links while creating a page, and on templates

fields.description: siteRoot and baseUrl in RenderContext are separate variables, and we don't set them properly anyway.
fields.summary: RenderContext is confused over siteRoot and baseUrl

fields.description: The link next to the group shows 100 even if there are more members -- probably just reporting the size of the first page.
fields.summary: Manage groups reports only 100 members per group for LDAP groups
Option for {attachments} macro: sortbyfield=xy, reverse=true|false

fields.description:
Attempting to use Adaptavist's {link-page} and {add-page} macros (which add a linked page from a template as a child of another), I found out that when I use a template that contains a variable, the operation runs well. If I use a markup-only macro, the operation results in an orphaned page (everything else the same)

David Peterson helped me up to the point where it was determined that the Confluence command used in both cases (with or without the variable inside a template) was essentially the same. At that point, he concluded that there is a bug in Confluence, and that i should post the bug. 

This bug is absolutely CRITICAL for our implementation, as our workflow relies a lot on beiing able to create a set of templated pages for users on command.

This is the thread that took David to draw the conclusion that the problem is inside Confluence:

> OK, I did the following:
>
> 1. Created a template called "Test without variable" which has only 
> one line that says:
>    This is markup
>
> 2. Create another template called "Test with variable", which has TWO
> lines:
>    This is markup
>    This is a variable: @var@
>
> 3. Wrote yet another test page called YAT. It has two lines, as 
> follows (minus the line braks):
>    {link-page:parent=YAT|template=Test with variable}Click to link a 
> new Product!{link-page}
>    {add-page:parent=YAT|template= Test with variable}Click to add a 
> new Product!{add-page}
>
> 4. Clicked on the two links of YAT as it looks above (while clicking, 
> the URL's produced are listed below). While I was entering the 
> variables, the breadcrumbs pointed to "Dashboard > Root page > Browse 
> Space > Create Page". When I entered the edit session (after 
> submitting the variables), the breadcrumbs were the same. When I 
> pressed "Save", it saved the page as YAT's child.
>
> http://myserver/pages/createpage-entervariables.action? 
> spaceKey=Obj&link
> Creation=false&fromPageId=919&templateName=Test+with
> +variable&templateId
> =60
>
> http://myserver/pages/createpage-entervariables.action? 
> spaceKey=Obj&link
> Creation=false&fromPageId=919&templateName=Test+with
> +variable&templateId
> =60
>
>
> 5. I edited YAT and replaced "Test with variable" with "Test without 
> variable". When I pressed "Save", the page was saved as an orphan
>
> http://myserver/pages/createpage-entervariables.action? 
> spaceKey=Obj&link
> Creation=false&fromPageId=919&templateName=Test+without
> +variable&templat
> eId=68
>
> http://myserver/pages/createpage-entervariables.action? 
> spaceKey=Obj&link
> Creation=false&fromPageId=919&templateName=Test+without
> +variable&templat
> eId=68

---------------------------------- David's responde follows:
Well, you're out of my hands then - there would seem to be a problem with Confluence's templates. It would be a good idea to submit this as a bug in jira.atlassian.com. I'll definitely vote for it if you post the issue number here.
fields.summary: Creating and linking a page produces different results depending on whether the template contains variables or not

fields.description: Making a page with a name including characters as "ä", "ö", "ü" .... results in problems when linking from another page to that page (with the "ä", "ö", "ü" in the name). Making the link, confluence adds the green "+" at the end of the link (as if the page would not exist).
fields.summary: Linking problems when page name contains "ä", "ö", "ü"...

fields.description:
Scenario:

A page with attachments is moved from Space A to Space B.
After the move, the attachments are still linked to the page but when browsing the Space, the attachments are not listed in Space B but still in Space A.
fields.summary: After moving a page with attachments to a new Space, the attachments are listed in the old Space not on the new Space

fields.description:
Setup Steps:
- Custom Install
- External Database: Microsoft SQL Server
- Connect via a Datasource
- Datasource Name: jdbc/ConfDS
and confluence failed.
fields.summary: Error occured during installing confluence

fields.description: If a user enters in the direct URL to an attachment, rather than being being shown the 404 "page not found" page, "401 Unauthorized" appears. It should be the 404 instead.
fields.summary: Accessing an unauthorized download directly returns a "401 Unauthorized" page, rather than "Page Not Found"

fields.description:
I picked this up when testing Confluence's HTTP headers with netcat.

Would only affect users if they've modified their browser to omit the User-Agent header in requests.
fields.summary: NPE in attachment download if no User-Agent header in request
Allow the excerpt-include macro to work across spaces

fields.description:
I have anonymous access enabled in my site. an anonymous user can see all three spaces I have created in my site. when a user logs in they are only able to see sites that they have permissions for.

it seems to me that an authenticated user should never have less permissions than an anonymous user. how can I ensure that an authenticated user can always see everything that an anonymous can see?
fields.summary: users lose access by logging in
Shorten RSS URLs

fields.description:
Migration tool needs to be connected to the customers LDAP repository so that it can determine that a user account is linked to an external LDAP account. 

Once we've determined such a user, we ought to grant them external membership rather than internal membership. (in programmatic terms, the old OSUser account should be migrated to be an AltassianUser "external user" whose membership should be recorded in the EXTERNAL_MEMBERS table).
fields.summary: Migration tool used to move from OSUSer to AtlassianUser should distinguish external users

fields.description:
Allow user to enter LaTeX code and have Confluence render the output as a Wiki page.

Note: This is the reverse functionality requested by CONF-2588.
fields.summary: Rendering LaTeX in Confluence
